message.content:
cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.CG, cs.NA, cs.CR 

This paper deals with the problem of locality sensitive hashing, which is a fundamental problem in computer science related to data structures and algorithms. The paper uses techniques from the geometry of numbers to show the existence of lattices achieving the optimal LSH exponent of 1/c^2. This suggests that the paper is likely to be classified under cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.IT (Information Theory), which are the most relevant sub-categories for this topic. Additionally, the paper also involves computational geometry (cs.CG), numerical analysis (cs.NA), and cryptography (cs.CR) to some extent, which are other possible sub-categories.
